election_record.label: New Jersey 1806 Legislative Council, Somerset County

overview.note: "As far as our information extends, the following counties have returned full federal representations to the Legislature, viz. Bergen, Middlesex, Somerset, Burlington, Gloucester and Cape-May. ... In the counties of Bergen and Somerset there was no democratic opposition to the Federal Tickets." Trenton Federalist (Trenton, NJ). October 27, 1806.
"The federal ticket in Somerset, has carried with little or no opposition." Guardian; or, New-Brunswick Advertiser (New Brunswick, NJ). October 23, 1806.
"In Somerset County. The federal ticket has succeeded, viz. John Frelinghuysen for Council." The Centinel of Freedom (Newark, NJ). October 21, 1806.

election_record.reference: The Centinel of Freedom (Newark, NJ). October 21, 1806.
Guardian; or, New-Brunswick Advertiser (New Brunswick, NJ). October 23, 1806.
The Centinel of Freedom (Newark, NJ). October 28, 1806.
